column2: Behavioural analysis on how different populations are responding to the pandemic

Behavioral analysis of how populations are responding to the pandemic - based on a monthly survey where respondents note counts of various activities along with a 0-100 score related to how much they agree with a given statement
Jones, Sarah P., Imperial College London Big Data Analytical Unit and YouGov Plc. 2020, Imperial College London YouGov Covid Data Hub, v1.0, YouGov Plc, April 2020

column5: Description
Nameof country
Count of days passed since Covid-19 outbreak began
Number of household contacts for the previous day (averaged by country)
Total number of contacts for the previous day (averaged by country)
Number of times the respondent left the house on the previous day (averaged by country)
Number of times the respondent washed their hands on the previous day (averaged by country)
Score (0-100) related to how much the respondent would be willing to isolate if syptomatic (100 = very willing)
Score (0-100) related to how much the respondent would be willing to isolate if advised (100 = very willing)
Score (0-100) related to how difficult isolating would be (100 = very difficult)
Score (0-100) related to how often the respondent wears a mask outside (100 = all the time)
Score (0-100) related to how often the respondent wears a mask while at a grocery store (100 = all the time)
Score (0-100) related to how often the respondent wears a mask while at a clothing store (100 = all the time)
Score (0-100) related to how often the respondent wears a mask while at work (100 = all the time)
Score (0-100) related to how often the respondent wears a mask while on public transport (100 = all the time)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to avoid symptomatic people (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to avoid going out (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to avoid healthcare settings people (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to avoid public transport (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to avoid working outside the home (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent and their children takes to avoid school (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to avoid having guests (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to avoid small gatherings (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to avoid medium gatherings (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to avoid large gatherings (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to avoid crowded areas (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to avoid shops (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to clean surfaces (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to cover their mouth while sneezing (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how much effort the respondent takes to use hand sanitiser (100 = maximum effort)
Score (0-100) related to how dangergerous the respondent thinks Covid is (100 = very dangerous)
Score (0-100) related to how likely the respondent thinks they are to contract Covid (100 = certain)
Score (0-100) related to how much the respondents live is impacted (100 = maximum impact)
